title: Epic: Native macOS Python Data Science IDE
description:
**Project goal:**

Create a high-performance, native macOS alternative to Jupyter Notebooks. The app ("PythonSwift") allows users to write and execute Python code in a block-based interface, visualize data (plots/tables), and manage files, all within a sandboxed, native SwiftUI environment.

**Architecture (sidecar pattern):**

*   **Frontend (Swift):** A multi-column SwiftUI app (`NotebookView`).
    *   **IPC:** Uses `PythonService` (Actor) to spawn a local Python subprocess (`python_env/bin/python3`) and communicate via JSON-RPC over Stdin/Stdout.
    *   **State:** `NotebookViewModel` manages the list of `NotebookCellModel` (Code/Markdown) and syncs variable state with the backend.
    *   **Persistence:** Notebooks are saved as `.json` files containing cell inputs and outputs.
*   **Backend (Python):** A lightweight script (`server.py`) running in a loop.
    *   **Execution:** Uses `exec()` with a persistent `EXEC_GLOBALS` dictionary to maintain state between cells.
    *   **Output capture:** Captures `stdout` and `stderr`. Detects `matplotlib` figures and renders them as Base64 PNGs.
    *   **Introspection:** `get_variables` method inspects `EXEC_GLOBALS` to populate the Swift-side Variable Inspector.

**Current status (MVP complete):**

*   ✅ **Execution:** Can run Python code and see text/image outputs.
*   ✅ **Plotting:** Matplotlib integration works (renders inline images).
*   ✅ **UI:** Native 3-pane layout (Sidebar, Notebook, Inspector).
*   ✅ **Persistence:** Save/Load notebooks.
*   ✅ **Environment:** Scripts to setup local `venv` with `numpy`, `pandas`, `matplotlib`.

**Roadmap (next steps):**

*   Syntax highlighting (using `Runestone` or similar).
*   Interactive DataFrame viewing (native `Table` for Pandas).
*   Autocomplete/Intellisense.
*   Streaming output for long-running tasks.

title: Real-time Output Streaming
description: Refactor `server.py` and `PythonService.swift` to support real-time streaming of `stdout` (for example, training loops) instead of waiting for cell completion. This requires chunked JSON or a separate stream channel.

title: Establish IPC Architecture
description: Define JSON-RPC protocol and standard IO pipes for Swift-Python communication.

title: Python Backend Service
description: Implement server.py with exec(), variable inspection, and stdout capture.

title: Notebook UI Implementation
description: Create NotebookView, CellView, and Sidebar with SwiftUI.

title: Rich Media Output (Plots)
description: Support Matplotlib plot generation and rendering in Swift cells.

title: Syntax Highlighting
description: Add syntax highlighting to CodeEditorView using SourceEditor or similar.

title: Notebook Persistence
description: Implement save/load of notebook files including images.

title: Interactive DataFrame Viewer
description: Implement a native SwiftUI Table or Spreadsheet view to display Pandas DataFrames interactively (sort/filter) instead of just string representation. Backend should support a `get_dataframe_data` RPC method.
design:
Backend Implementation:
1. Detect DataFrame in EXEC_GLOBALS after execution
2. Add new RPC method "get_dataframe" to serialize as JSON
3. Handle NaN/Infinity values by converting to null/string

Frontend Implementation:
1. Create DataFrameOutputView SwiftUI component
2. Use SwiftUI Table with dynamic columns
3. Support scrolling for large datasets (>100 rows)
4. Make it Codable for notebook persistence
acceptance_criteria:
1. Running `import pandas as pd; pd.DataFrame({"A": [1,2], "B": [3,4]})` displays a native table
2. Table has sortable columns (click headers)
3. Table scrolls properly for DataFrames with >100 rows
4. Notebooks with DataFrame tables can be saved and loaded
5. NaN values display as empty cells
6. Mixed data types (int, float, string) display correctly

title: Code Autocomplete / Intellisense
description: Integrate `jedi` or a similar library in `server.py` to provide code completion suggestions to the Swift frontend. Implement a completion UI in `CodeEditorView`.

title: Analyze and Setup Native macOS App & Share Extension
description: Analyze the current codebase to ensure a native macOS app structure (not Catalyst) and verify/fix the macOS Share Extension.

title: Analyze AI Coding Agent Repositories
description: Comprehensive analysis of AI coding agent repositories: claude-code, codex, gemini-cli, iflow, kimi, qwen-agent, qwen-code. Focus on architecture, harness, tools, and implementation details.

title: Study Apple TextKit sample and document insights for macOS development
description: Comprehensively analyzed Apple's 'Enriching Your Text in Text Views' TextKit 2 sample. Studied advanced text processing patterns, view-based attachments, exclusion paths, and cross-platform implementations. Documented detailed insights in LEARNINGS.md and contributed to OpenCode-SWIFTDB.md with reusable patterns and code examples.

title: PS-8: Interactive DataFrame Viewer
description: Replace string outputs of Pandas DataFrames with a native SwiftUI Table (scrollable, sortable columns). Update server.py to serialize DataFrame content as JSON. Update NotebookView to render DataFrameOutputView.

title: PS-10: Real-time Output Streaming
description: Refactor the IPC layer so long-running Python tasks stream their stdout line-by-line to the UI immediately. Update protocol, server.py, and PythonService.swift.

title: PS-6: Syntax Highlighting
description: Implement a lightweight syntax highlighter for the CodeEditorView using Regex/TextKit. Support colors for keywords, strings, comments, numbers.

title: PS-11: Traceback Formatting
description: Improve the display of Python tracebacks to be distinct and readable. Parse tracebacks in backend/frontend and render with style.

title: Re-enable CodeEditorView for syntax highlighting
description: CodeEditorView was temporarily disabled during build rescue to isolate issues. The code exists in SyntaxHighlightingTextView.swift and should be re-integrated into NotebookView.swift once Phase 2 features are validated.

title: Validate Phase 2 features end-to-end
description: Critical: Build was completely broken when Copilot CLI arrived. All Phase 2 features need comprehensive end-to-end testing. Run test_phase2.ipynb and verify DataFrame viewing, streaming output, and error formatting work correctly.

title: Fixed critical build failures - source file corruption
description: Resolved: Found the project in a completely unbuildable state. Fixed literal newline escapes in `NotebookView.swift`, restored the missing `CodeEditorView` wrapper, and fixed output handling bugs in `NotebookViewModel`. The build now succeeds. See `BUILD_RESCUE_REPORT.md` for full details.

title: Modernize Kelvin CAS
description: Update to Swift 6.2, fix tests, optimize Tokenizer and Matrix
